result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert V Chadwick Jr was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $500 applied from bond. $1019  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: for Treatment (Incompetency)

Defendant Robert V Chadwick in court with attorney Mark W. Frank. Prosecuting Atty Joseph E. Mimier appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Court rec'd competency report.  ADA and Defense believe Defn is not competent to proceed at this time, but will be treated to competency within statutory time limits.  ADA states it is 50/50 if defn will be treated to competency.   ADA  moves court to order treatment to competency on outpatient basis.  ADA requestS treatment order.   Court states she normally would have to order the Department to determine inpatient or outpatient.  ADA understands but believes the department will go along with what the court orders.     Atty Frank joins in the recommendations.      Defn stands mute to question of being competent or not competent.   Atty Frank states defn has no objection to medication trial as recommended by Dr. Smith.  Counsel waive putting on evidence today.   Counsel rely on Dr Smith's report.  Court finds defn incompetent to proceed, but may be treated to competency within statutory time period on outpatient basis.  Court reaffirms probable cause finding.  Court finds defn is not competent to refuse medication or treatment.   Reports shall be filed every 90 days.  Court finds outpatient treatment is the most appropriate for defn.   If department disagrees with outpatient treatment, the department shall notify the court immediately so the court can take appropriate steps.  TR files to follow 15CF1253
of Dr. Brad Smith received.  Copies distributed.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List (Plaintiff's)
to be completed the Dept of Health Services.

Atty Frank moves court to order competency eval of defn.  Atty Frank doubts defn's competency.  Reasons outlined on record.  ADA objectgs stating Atty Frnaks has not met his burden.  Continued statement by Atty Frank.  Court finds probable cause and orders competency evaluation.  Dept to decide outpatient or inpatient.  Bail continued.  Court will set case for comp hearing on 9/15/15 @ 10:30 a.m.
1ST REVISIOn-DPA MODIFICATION.  Cases 15CF286,15CF314 and 15CF1253(new case).  Payments of $80/mo to continue.  DPA to be retained in 15CF286.

Defendant appeared.  Jason D. Sanders appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has court-appointed attorney for other cases but does not believe Atty Frank has yet to be appointed to this case. Atty Mark Frank appears in court. Atty Frank confirms that he has not yet been appointed to this case. Defendant waives time limits. Court finds good cause for setover.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $500.00 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $5,000.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
